title: Prac 2
text:
1 Question 1


Code
set.seed(1)
x <- 1:100
y <- sin(x/10) + rnorm(100,,sd=0.2)




2 Question 2


Code
# Custom LOWESS function
customLowess <- function(x, y, f) {
  n <- length(x)
  y_smooth <- numeric(n)
  
  for (i in 1:n) {
    # Calculate distances
    dists <- abs(x - x[i])
    
    # Determine the span width
    span <- sort(dists)[round(f * n)]
    
    # Identify weights using the tricube function
    weights <- (1 - (dists / span)^3)^3 * (dists < span)
    
    # Fit a weighted linear regression
    if (sum(weights) > 0) {
      fit <- lm(y ~ x, weights = weights)
      y_smooth[i] <- predict(fit, newdata = data.frame(x = x[i]))
    } else {
      y_smooth[i] <- y[i]
    }
  }
  return(y_smooth)
}

# Smoothing factor
f <- 0.2

# Apply custom LOWESS
y_custom <- customLowess(x, y, f)

# Apply built-in lowess with iter = 0
lowess_result <- lowess(x, y, f = f, iter = 0)




3 Question 3


Code
plot(x, y, pch = 16, col = "gray", main = "Custom vs Built-in LOWESS", xlab = "x", ylab = "y")

# Plot custom LOWESS curve
lines(x, y_custom, col = "blue", lwd = 2, lty = 2)

# Plot built-in LOWESS curve
lines(lowess_result, col = "red", lwd = 2)

# Add legend
legend("topright", legend = c("Custom LOWESS", "Built-in LOWESS"), col = c("blue", "red"), lty = c(2, 1), lwd = 2)

title: Practical 1
text:
This report explores the built-in R airquality and cars datasets.
We will:
üéØIdentify missing values
üéØCompute summary statistics
üéØPerform a linear regression using matrix calculations and verify the results

title: Practical 1
text:
5.1 Conclusion
üéâ The calculated estimates match the output of the fitted lm regression!

title: Practical Day 4
text:
3.1 Explanation
Sd measures variability in data. Thus, if all flights for a carrier in month 1 show the same distance, there is no variation in the data and thus the sd will be 0, as is the case with carriers F9, AS, etc. Moreover, if a carrier, such as OO, has 1 or less flights in month 1, then there is no variability to measure and the denominator of the sd formula will be 0, which is why ‚ÄúNA‚Äù is returned by R.

title: Practical Day 4
text:
7.1 Explanation
Here‚Äôs a breakdown of anomalies found in the dataset based on the unique values that were found:

7.1.1 1. Typos & Inconsistencies

gender: ‚Äúfemal‚Äù should be corrected to ‚Äúfemale‚Äù.
disease_status: ‚ÄúHealthy‚Äù should be converted to lowercase (‚Äúhealthy‚Äù) for consistency.



7.1.2 2. Missing Entries (NAs)

height: Contains missing values (NA).
glucose: Contains missing values (NA).
